column2: знао m / знала f / знало n
column3: знали m / знале f / знала n

column2: знан m / знана f / знано n
column3: знани m / знане f / знана n

column1: 1   For the masculine; agent of feminine or neuter gender would use the feminine and neuter gender forms of the active past participle and the auxiliary verb, respectively.
до̀знати ‎(“to find out”)  зна́нац m ‎(“acquaintance”)  зна̏но̄ст f ‎(“science”)  зна́ње n ‎(“knowledge”)
column3: по̀знати ‎(“to know, have knowledge of; to recognize, make out”)  препо̀знати ‎(“to recognize”)  прѝзнати ‎(“to acknowledge, recognize; to own, confess; to admit; to concede the claim; to appreciate; to plead guilty”)  раза̀знати ‎(“to distinguish, make out, differentiate”)
column5: распо̀знати ‎(“to tell apart, recognize, discern, make out”)  са̀знати ‎(“to find out, come to know”)  спо̀знати ‎(“to comprehend, conceive; to become aware or cognizant of; to learn”)  упо̀знати ‎(“to get acquainted with; to meet, get introduced to; learn; experience”)
